T1112: [IPsec Helper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1132) can make arbitrary changes to registry keys based on provided input.(Citation: SentinelOne Agrius 2021)
[Lokibot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0447) has modified the Registry as part of its UAC bypass process.(Citation: Talos Lokibot Jan 2021)
[ZxShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0412) can create Registry entries to enable services to run.(Citation: Talos ZxShell Oct 2014)

[KONNI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0356) has modified registry keys of ComSysApp, Svchost, and xmlProv on the machine to gain persistence.(Citation: Medium KONNI Jan 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Konni Aug 2021)

[Embargo](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1247) has modified and deleted Registry keys to add services, and to disable Security Solutions such as Windows Defender.(Citation: ESET Embargo Ransomware October 2024)

[Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has modified the Registry key HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest by setting the UseLogonCredential registry value to 1 in order to force credentials to be stored in clear text in memory. [Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) has also modified the WDigest registry key to allow plaintext credentials to be cached in memory.(Citation: CrowdStrike Grim Spider May 2019)(Citation: Mandiant FIN12 Oct 2021)
[APT32](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0050)'s backdoor has modified the Windows Registry to store the backdoor's configuration. (Citation: ESET OceanLotus Mar 2019)

[Aquatic Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0143) modified the victim registry to enable the `RestrictedAdmin` mode feature, allowing for pass the hash behaviors to function via RDP.(Citation: Crowdstrike HuntReport 2022)
[Pysa](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0583) has modified the registry key “SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System” and added the ransom note.(Citation: CERT-FR PYSA April 2020)
During [Operation Honeybee](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0006), the threat actors used batch files that modified registry keys.(Citation: McAfee Honeybee)
